issue.title: CLI tools do not provide option to use custom factory implementations
issue.body:
Currenty, the `build` and `validate` commands do not provide a way to use a `ParameterStoreFactory` or `DefinitionProviderFactory` outside of the default options. This effectively renders these commands useless unless you're using the default functionality.

To remedy this, we should do the following:

- Create a new facade (traditional OOP pattern) for easily running the Annotated Container CLI in just a couple lines of code.
- Document process for creating your own script, explaining why we suggest you do this.
- Deprecate the existing `bin/annotated-container`, suggesting use of the new documented process for creating your own script.

issue.title: Allow Bootstrap to receive custom configuration
issue.body: Currently the Annotated Container configuration is an XML file. The Bootstrap requires this XML file to work properly. However, it is possible a user implements their own `BootstrappingConfiguration` instance and would like to use that. We should update the Bootstrap functionality to support this.

issue.title: Remove all references to injecting a property
issue.body: In 3.0 injecting a property was removed and is no longer supported. There are still lingering references to this in code and documentation. This should be removed.

commits.message: Remove references to injecting a property in code (#382)

issue.title: Ensure CompositeDefinitionProvider::__toString refactored into DefnitionProvider interface
issue.body: We are currently "hacking" our improved logging when using the CompositeDefinitionProvider. Instead of implementing `__toString` we should update the `DefinitionProvider` interface to require a `toString()` method. This requires v3 as changing the interface is a BC break.

comment.body: As we removed logging from AC directly and plan on moving it to a separate library it isn't clear what needs to be changed about this. Am closing this for now and may open a new issue when logging is re-implemented.

issue.title: Ensure CompositeDefinitionProvider::__toString refactored into DefnitionProvider interface
issue.body: We are currently "hacking" our improved logging when using the CompositeDefinitionProvider. Instead of implementing `__toString` we should update the `DefinitionProvider` interface to require a `toString()` method. This requires v3 as changing the interface is a BC break.

issue.title: Refactor methods to not use `get`
issue.body: The `get` prefix tends to be noisy with very little signal, especially since we make very little use of setter methods. All methods prefixed with `get` should have this prefix removed.

commits.message:
Task/refactor out get methods (#380)

* Rename AutowireableParameter getters

* Rename BootstrappingConfiguration getters

* Rename BootstrappingDirectoryResolver getters

* Rename ServiceFromServiceDefinition getters

* Rename ServiceGatherer getters

* Rename ThirdPartyInitializer getters

* Rename ThirdPartyInitializerProvider getters

* Rename Command getters

* Rename CommandExecutor getters

* Rename Input getters

* Rename TerminalOutput getters

* Rename AliasDefinitionResolution getters

* Rename StandardAliasDefinitionResolver getters

* Rename AbstractContainerFactory getters

* Rename AurynContainerFactoryState getters

* Rename ContainerFactoryOptions getters

* Rename HasMethodInject getters

* Rename HasSerivcePrepareState getters

* Rename IlluminateContainerFactoryState getters

* Rename ParameterStore getters

* Rename PhpDiContainerFactoryState getters

* Rename AliasDefinition getters

* Rename ContainerDefinition getters

* Rename ContainerDefintionBuilder getters

* Rename Definition getters

* Rename LogicalConstraint getter

* Rename ContainerDefinitionAnalysisOptionsBuilder getter

* Rename AnnotatedContainer getter

* Rename AnnotatedContainerVersion getters

* Rename InjectTargetIdentifier getters

issue.title: Remove all references to injecting a property
issue.body: In 3.0 injecting a property was removed and is no longer supported. There are still lingering references to this in code and documentation. This should be removed.

issue.title: Refactor Bootstrap to use static constructors
issue.body:
Currently the Bootstrap object uses a public constructor with a relatively large amount of dependencies, all of them optional. For most out-of-the-box use cases there's only 1 or 2 of these that are typically necessary to provide. Having 1 constructor is not intuitive when you'd want to override dependencies and makes bootstrapping clunkier than it has to be.

In 3.0 a series of static constructor methods should be created that will satisfy common bootstrapping scenarios without always having to be exposed to the full complexity of bootstrapping.

commits.message:
Feature/bootstrap constructors (#378)

* Introduce DefaultDefinitionProviderFactory

* Use static Bootstrap constructors. Fixes #369
